Literature Review: Osteocalcin, a multifaceted bone-derived hormone, has garnered significant attention in recent years due to its profound influence on various aspects of energy metabolism and beyond. The discovery of osteocalcin's role in regulating energy metabolism has been extensively studied, and the results have been nothing short of remarkable. This review aims to provide an overview of the current state of knowledge on osteocalcin's functions, with a focus on its regulation of energy metabolism, as well as its other roles in steroidogenesis, neurotransmitter biosynthesis, male fertility, electrolyte homeostasis, cognition, the acute stress response, and exercise capacity. We will also explore the potential common theme between osteocalcin's functions and its structural functions in bone.
